sen.e: WAKE no Hiromushi (730-799) was a lady-in-waiting in the Nara period.

sen.e: She served the retired Empress Koken and followed her Imperial Highness' step to entered the priesthood in 762 and called herself 'Hokin.'

sen.e: In 765, she was given the surname 'Kibi no Fujinnowake no Mahito' and created 'Daini' (great female Buddhist monk) in 768.

sen.e: In the following year, upon the Imperial decree, she was instructed to receive an oracle from Usa Hachimangu Shrine.

sen.e: At that time, however, she was unable to stand a long-distance travel because of her delicate health and asked her younger brother, WAKE no Kiyomaro, to receive the oracle by proxy.

sen.j: その神託の結果が道鏡の意に反していたことから還俗させられた。
sen.e: Since the result of the oracle was against the expectation of Dokyo, her priesthood was deprived (she was forced to return to secular life).

sen.j: 弟の清麻呂は別部穢麻呂（わけべのきたなまろ）と改名させられて大隅国へ、広虫は別部広虫売（わけべのひろむしめ）と改名させられて備後国へ、それぞれ配流に処せられた。
sen.e: Her brother Kiyomaro was forced to change his name to 'WAKEBE no Kitanamaro' (the word 'kitana' (dirty) is the antonym of the word 'kiyo' (clean)) and displaced to Osumi Province, whereas Hiromushi was forced to change her name to 'WAKEBE no Hiromushi-me' (the suffix '-me' suggests 'a disgraced woman') and displaced to Bingo Province.
